Package modelCheckCTL.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
modelCheckCTL.controller.Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
Runs end to end tests, reads input files, validates the model and formula, and runs the model checker

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(Model model, View view, Options options) throws java.lang.Exception
      Kicks off the program after being called from Main
      Parameters:
      model - The model (MVC "model", not CTL "model" in this case) stores the Kripke filename, the ctl model to test, the state to check, the command line arguments and the Kripke data
      view - The view in this version is just a rudimentary command line output that says if the state(s) hold for the model and tries to give meaningful error messages if anything failed along the way.
      options - Two command line arguments are mandatory: -k specifying the Kripke filename and then either -a or -f . There is an optional -s argument specifying a state to check.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.Exception

  • Method Details

    • runProgram

      public void runProgram​(Options options) throws java.lang.Exception
      This is the meat and potatoes of the program - all the major function calls are here. Proecesses the arguments, runs tests, runs the model checking
      Parameters:
      options - Two command line arguments are mandatory: -k specifying the Kripke filename and then either -a or -f . There is an optional -s argument specifying a state to check.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.Exception

    • modelCheck

      public java.util.Set modelCheck​(java.lang.String kripkeFilepath, java.lang.String formula) throws java.io.IOException, ParseException
      Model checks a single supplied formula on a single supplied model. Returns the Set of States which hold for the formula.
      Parameters:
      kripkeFilepath - String of the file/filepath of the kripke file. Will be like kripke.txt if the file is in /resources or like end-to-end-tests/kripe.txt if in a subfolder of /resources.
      formula - String CTL formula to model check
      Returns:
      the Set of States which hold for the formula.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      ParseException

    • validateModelFormulaAndStateToCheck

      public ValidationResults validateModelFormulaAndStateToCheck​(Options options) throws java.lang.Exception
      Validates an individual model, formula and state to check for syntax errors (in the case of model/formula) and checks if the state to check is in the model
      Parameters:
      options - Options object with options specified by user in the command line arguments as well as the hardcoded options at the top of Main.java
      Returns:
      A ValidationResults results object, which contains three custom results objects, one for the model validation results, one for the formula validation results and one for the state to check validation results
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • validateModel

      public ValidateModelResults validateModel​(Options options) throws java.lang.Exception
      Validates an individual model to check for any syntax errors
      Parameters:
      options - Options object with options specified by user in the command line arguments as well as the hardcoded options at the top of Main.java
      Returns:
      A ValidateModelResults results object, which contains a Boolean for whether the model passed validation or not, the kripke filepath and any original error message which may have occurred in the original parsing of the kripke file
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • validateFormula

      public ValidateFormulaResults validateFormula​(java.lang.String formula) throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException, ParseException
      Validates an individual formula to check for any syntax errors (ie, whether it is well formed)
      Parameters:
      formula - String the formula to check for syntax errors
      Returns:
      A ValidateFormulaResults results object, which contains a Boolean for whether the formula passed validation or not, the formula, the formula filename and an errors which occured during validation
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      ParseException

    • validateStateToCheck

      public ValidateStateToCheckResults validateStateToCheck​(java.lang.String stateToCheck, java.util.Set statesInModel)
      Checks whether the specified State to check is in the model
      Returns:
      A ValidateStateToCheckResults results object, which contains a Boolean for whether the state to check is in the model and also the name of the state to check
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • getFormula

      public java.lang.String getFormula​(Options options) throws java.io.IOException
      Gets the user inputted CTL formula, regardless if formula was supplied directly in the command line arguments or in a file containing just the formula
      Parameters:
      options - Options object with options specified by user in the command line arguments as well as the hardcoded options at the top of Main.java
      Returns:
      String CTL formula, ie. EXp
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getFormulaFromUserFile

      public java.lang.String getFormulaFromUserFile​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Parses a specified text file (which only contains a CTL formula in the first line and has no additional lines) for a CTL formula and returns the formula. Does not check to make sure the formula is well formed (that happens later). Read input stream line by line with BufferedReader approach from https://stackoverflow.com/a/55420102, accessed 9/18/21
      Parameters:
      filename - String of filename to find the CTL formula. This file should be in /resources
      Returns:
      String of the CTL formula in the text file (ie, EXp)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getKripkeFileObj

      public KripkeFileObj getKripkeFileObj​(java.lang.String kripkeFilepath) throws java.io.IOException
      Parses a text file containing information for a specific Kripke structure and returns a Kripke with all that info. Kripke text file must be in a format like this: s1, s2, s3, s4; t1 : s1 - s2, (transition t1 is from state s1 to state s2) t2 : s1 - s3, t3 : s3 – s4, t4 : s4 – s2, t5 : s2 – s3; s1 : p q, (propositional atom names are separated by a space; a name consists of letters, it is casesensitive) s2 : q t r, s3 : , (i.e. set of propositional atoms for state s3 is empty) s4 : t;
      Parameters:
      kripkeFilepath - String filename of a kripke text file
      Returns:
      A Kripke object
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • validateEndToEndTestModels

      public java.util.List validateEndToEndTestModels​(Options options) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks the CTL models in the end to end tests to see if they're well formed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.Exception

    • validateEndToEndTestModel

      public ValidateModelResults validateEndToEndTestModel​(java.lang.String kripkeFilepath, Options options) throws java.lang.Exception
      Checks a CTL end to end model to see if they're well formed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
      java.lang.Exception

    • getFormulaFileObjList

      public java.util.List getFormulaFileObjList​(java.lang.String formulasFilename, Options options) throws java.io.IOException
      This creates a List of EndToEndFormulaFileObjs for the end to end tests. Parses each test file and pulls out all the formulas, states to check and the expected result from each Read input stream line by line approach with the BufferedReader from https://stackoverflow.com/a/55420102, accessed 9/18/21
      Parameters:
      formulasFilename - A String filename for formula files. Ie, "Model 1 - Test Formulas.txt"
      Returns:
      a List of EndToEndFormulaFileObjs with details from the test formula files (formulas, states to check and the expected result)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
